meanings.definition: To make a popping or bubbling sound.
meanings.sent1: The pot on the stove started poppling as the water inside heated up.
meanings.sent2: I heard the popcorn poppling in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: The soda can was so fizzy, it couldn't stop poppling when I opened it.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops poppling on the roof sounded like a lively drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The hot oil in the pan began poppling as soon as I dropped in the diced onions.

meanings.sent1: The poppling of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent2: We could see the gentle poppling of the water in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The poppling of the tiny waves made the beach look like it was giggling.
meanings.sent4: The poppling of the waves reminded me of a pot of boiling water.
meanings.sent5: The poppling of the stream over the rocks created a peaceful melody.

meanings.definition: To move with a quick, popping motion.
meanings.sent1: The kernels started poppling in the hot pan.
meanings.sent2: The fish poppling in the water caught my eye.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn poppling out of the bowl surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The bubbles poppling in the soda made it extra refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The firecrackers poppling in the distance signaled the start of the celebration.
